  3. Beinn Liath Mhor

Beinn Liath Mhor

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn Liath Mhor is a long, multiple-summited sandstone ridge with steep flanks and a summit sprinkled with white quartzite. It offers interesting views over the Coulin Forest and into Torridon.

 You have not climbed Beinn Liath Mhor.

Region: Torridon

Altitude: 926 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.86/5
Rating: 3.9/5 (71 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn Liath Mhor from Achnashellach

Other routes and challenges

Beinn Liath Mhor is often ascended together with Sgorr Ruadh - the route description above includes how to link them together. It is possible for the very fit to extend the route with Fuar Tholl as well.

Much longer approaches begin in Torridon, initially using old stalkers' paths either from Annat or past the Ling Hut.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Lochcarron Hotels

Lochcarron B&B

Lochcarron Cottages

Torridon Hostels
